results.title: Tertiary training in the RAAF
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film depicts the training and lifestyles of the RAAF cadets. It shows the three study courses that are available to them in Australia; degrees in science, engineering and business studies. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Terrorism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
A known terrorist invites a television producer to interview him in another country and without revealing his whereabouts to the police. Can such an interview be screened and should the police be informed Moderated by Benno Schmidt.

results.title: TERROR NULLIUS Acquisition
results.material_description: VHS case, hard drive with USB adaptor, paper ceritificate of authenticity
results.brief_description: The acquisition of time-based media artworks requires our collection team to develop a host of preservation strategies that often go unseen by visitors. These strategies include the receipt of master moving-image files and provenance documentation. Soda_Jerk’s acquisition, presented here, displays their political and humorous sense of creativity as the humble certificate of authenticity and external hard drive packaging get a playful overhaul, which reflects the subversive nature of the artwork, TERROR NULLIUS.

results.title: TERROR NULLIUS
results.brief_description: Equal parts political satire, eco-horror and road movie, TERROR NULLIUS is a rogue remapping of national mythology, where a misogynistic remark is met with the sharp beak of a bird, feminist bike gangs rampage and bicentenary celebrations are ravaged by flesh-eating sheep.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.description:
Hitch a ride into the dark heart of Australia with Soda_Jerk’s TERROR NULLIUS, a blistering, badly behaved sample-based film that confronts the horror of our contemporary moment.

Equal parts political satire, eco-horror and road movie, TERROR NULLIUS is a rogue remapping of national mythology, where a misogynistic remark is met with the sharp beak of a bird, feminist bike gangs rampage and bicentenary celebrations are ravaged by flesh-eating sheep.

By intricately remixing fragments of Australia’s pop culture and film legacy, TERROR NULLIUS interrogates the unstable entanglement of fiction that underpins this country’s vexed sense of self.

Following the success of The Was, their 2016 collaboration with The Avalanches, Soda_Jerk return with a work that’s dark, hopeful, irreverent and urgent.
description_for_label:
Hitch a ride into the dark heart of Australia with Soda_Jerk’s TERROR NULLIUS, a blistering, badly behaved sample-based film that confronts the horror of our contemporary moment.

Equal parts political satire, eco-horror and road movie, TERROR NULLIUS is a rogue remapping of national mythology, where a misogynistic remark is met with the sharp beak of a bird, feminist bike gangs rampage and bicentenary celebrations are ravaged by flesh-eating sheep.

By intricately remixing fragments of Australia’s pop culture and film legacy, TERROR NULLIUS interrogates the unstable entanglement of fiction that underpins this country’s vexed sense of self.

Following the success of The Was, their 2016 collaboration with The Avalanches, Soda_Jerk return with a work that’s dark, hopeful, irreverent and urgent.

production_dates.notes: Commissioned and exhibited at ACMI for the first time March 20 2018

results.title: Terror in the aisles
results.creator_credit: Andrew J Kuehn, Stephen Netburn and Kaleidoscope Films
results.brief_description: With excerpts from over fifty films from the horror genre, “Terror in the aisles” delivers a fast paced montage of some of the most terrifying scenes in cinema from the best of the horror genre. This collection is not for the faint-hearted but will satisfy the horror buff as some of the most classic scenes from the genre are revisited here. Some excerpts include: “The Exorcist”, “Psycho”, “Carrie”, “Shining”, “Rosemary’s baby”, “The Howling”, “Eyes of Laura Mars”, “Midnight express”, “Halloween”, “The Birds”, “Suspiria”, “Marathon man”, “Jaws”, “The Texas chainsaw massacre”, “Poltergeist”, “The Fog”, “Scanners and many more. Narrated by Donald Pleasence and Nancy Allen.

results.title: Terror by night
results.creator_credit: Roy William Neill and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: Sherlock Holmes and Watson find themselves aboard the London-Edinburgh Express, guarding the priceless “Star of Rhodesia” diamond. A series of murders leads them on a trail confused by disguise and impersonation. Starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. Adapted from a story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

results.title: Territorial rights
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 7 of a series of films for managers. Examines the reasons why so many misunderstandings occur between specialists and the “line” managers they advise. A film of an argument between a production manager and a services engineer is used as the basis for a discussion between personnel, finance and works managers, and consultants on the sources of interdepartmental problems. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Terra Nullius
results.creator_credit: Alison Wotherspoon, Anne Pratten and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Loosely based on the filmmaker’s personal experience, “Terra Nullius” is an impressionistic account of an eight year old Koori girl, Alice, growing up in a white adoptive family which denies her Aboriginality. The film examines how unacknowledged shame and fear passes from one generation to the next, from one culture to another. The last scene depicts a silent meeting between the young Alice and the adult Alice. In order to reclaim her life, Alice decides she must confront the pain and confusion of her childhood.

results.title: Terra nova
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Fernand Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Among these lively impressions of Newfoundland today, coloured by history and by the sea, there are scenes of historic events, fishing on the high seas and squid jigging inshore, mining deep underground, and operations of the giant pulp and paper industry. (Award: Los Angeles.)

results.title: Terra firma
results.brief_description:
This cut-out animation started life as a 5-metre long conte drawing inspired by the various unseen energies that influence and create a dimension.
Original music by Steve Fraser, Dennis Phelan, Luke Von Banbergern. Animation by Julian lawrence.
